=== Subject: Re: Moyer Family Introduction
From: Rob Moyer <rob.moyer@gmail.com>
To: "Monique (Mo) Brown" <drmoniquebrown@gmail.com>
Cc: christine moyer <christinemoyer@hotmail.com>
Date Sent: Sunday, December 17, 2023 10:02:48 AM GMT-08:00
Date Received: Sunday, December 17, 2023 10:02:48 AM GMT-08:00
Thanks for the clarifica�on. Yes, you are spot on. I am not at all trying to be difficult, the 60/40 statement was just
confusing to me. That's all.
I agree that 50/50 is a hard no at this �me. No ques�ons about that at all from me.
This is the explana�on I was hoping for, as it looked like I was possibly digressing.
I would also note that the weekends are almost fully booked for both kids, however.
From: Monique (Mo) Brown <drmoniquebrown@gmail.com>
Sent: Sunday, December 17, 2023 9:52 AM
To: Rob Moyer <rob.moyer@gmail.com>
Cc: chris�ne moyer <chris�nemoyer@hotmail.com>

I am a little confused by this email.  I am guessing that it is the percentage discrepancy that you are seeing with regards to
me saying that the split would equal 60/40 and you are seeing it as closer to 70/30.
50/50 at this time is a hard "no", which will then defer this process to the Court if that is going to be the sticking point.
It
looks like I made a mistake in saying 60/40 because the 60/40 option doesn't allow for both parents to have full weekends so
I altered it a little bit to allow for maximum continuity for the school week.  It is a 3/4 split giving one parent most of the
weekdays and the other parent weekends, which actually is not a fair split of quality time versus "parenting" time.  Robert,
please also remember that Christine doesn't actually have the kids with her during the day on weekdays.  They are usually at
school, so, in some ways, the percentage split is a bit arbitrary.
Please remember that this is a rough mock up with the intention of asking for comments to move toward a more fine tuned
draft.  I got Robert's comments on the document.  Once I get Christine's I will make some adjustments and will give more
than one option in the next draft.

On Sat, Dec 16, 2023 at 8:23 PM Rob Moyer <rob.moyer@gmail.com> wrote:

~Mo

From: Monique (Mo) Brown <drmoniquebrown@gmail.com>
Sent: Saturday, December 16, 2023 1:06:47 PM
To: Rob Moyer <rob.moyer@gmail.com>

Cc: Chris�ne Moyer <chris�nemoyer@hotmail.com>

I think that putting the children into therapy sooner than later is a wise choice.  I think it makes sense for that therapist to
meet with each of you once just to get your initial input.  Other than that, I would suggest that both of you be as uninvolved
in their therapy as possible.
I have attached the rough draft of my recommendations.  The wording is not in the final stages yet and will need some
editing.  Please take the liberty of using the "insert comment" function to give me your own individual feedback.  Please also
let me know if I missed anything or if there are other concerns that you want addressed.  I will add all your comments and
the children's feedback into a final draft.
I have also attached email guidelines.  My role is the parenting side.  I know that there is a lot of communication regarding
the divorce and property that are separate from parenting.
Lastly, I have attached a statement for charges thus far and a screen shot of my Venmo account.

=== Subject: Re: Moyer Family Introduction
From: Rob Moyer <rob.moyer@gmail.com>
To: Kari Betts <kari@lakesammamishtherapy.com>,Christine Moyer <christinemoyer@hotmail.com>
Date Sent: Saturday, December 16, 2023 12:16:38 PM GMT-08:00
Happy Saturday!

Thanks for the quick response. We are definitely looking forward to exploring options with you for Max, Adrian, and the
family. And I appreciate the options you outlined below. That said, over the last two days, Christine and I have both spent
considerable time with a therapist who is currently acting in a  lightweight way as our GAL to make recommendations for a
temporary parenting plan that we can use till official mediation happens. During those conversations, she offered to make
some recommendations for how we approach therapy for Max and Adrian appropriately, considering her work. So if we
could circle back next week, that would be ideal. If we need the two of you to talk directly as well, we would be happy to
arrange that.
thank you!
robert & Christine

=== Subject: Re: Moyer Family Introduction
From: Rob Moyer <rob.moyer@gmail.com>

Understood. In lieu of Family Therapy, is there something more appropriate that we should consider sooner than later? We
are making some pretty big decisions based on your $.02, so we might as well go all in. Christine?

of child-centered family therapy.  It may be too soon in this process for family therapy.  Obviously that is just my two cents.

From: Monique (Mo) Brown <drmoniquebrown@gmail.com>
Sent: Saturday, December 16, 2023 8:41:04 AM
To: Rob Moyer <rob.moyer@gmail.com>
Cc: Chris�ne Moyer <chris�nemoyer@hotmail.com>

So, generally when there is conflict between parents, to protect the children's therapy, I will include language similar to this:
The children's therapist should be protected from litigation by neither parent asking for their involvement in the custody
litigation whatsoever.  Neither parent should have the "ear" of the therapist by having side conversations with the therapist.
The therapist should not have side conversations with either parent.  Any communication should be written and include the
other parent, including communications from the therapist.  Neither parent should coach the children as to what they should
be telling the therapist.  Parents should, if possible, take turns bringing the children to their therapy appointments.

rob.moyer@gmail.com> wrote:

From: Rob Moyer <rob.moyer@gmail.com>

Good A�ernoon Dr Brown-
During our mee�ng, you expressed the need to get our kids into appropriate therapy as soon as possible. Chris�ne and I
agree wholeheartedly. You also noted that as part of your recommenda�on process, you like to apply some ground rules in
the kids' best interest. So, I promised to share the name and correspondence relevant to that effort later today. Please see
below. If you are comfortable sharing those recommenda�ons now, I will respond to Kari consistent with your guidance.
Alterna�vely, I can let her know we are working on some details and will be back in touch soon. Your call!
Thanks again for the chance to chat today.
best,
robert
P.S. Chris�ne will love those pups! I miss that sweet lovin already!  ̧
From: Kari Be�s <kari@lakesammamishtherapy.com>
Sent: Thursday, December 14, 2023 4:50 PM
To: Rob Moyer <rob.moyer@gmail.com>

Good Afternoon Robert and Christine,
Thank you for your message in regards to providing support to your children during this time of transition for your family.
There are several approaches we can take to support your children. One would be that I can meet with your children
individually/separately, and the children can process/share their concerns and feelings about the changes in your family
dynamic. I often think it is helpful to have the entire family together, after meeting with children a few times - so your
children can potentially tell you how they are managing the changes themselves and maybe even ask you both questions. In
addition to your children sharing their experiences, I would introduce them to CBT (cognitive behavioral therapy) to help
them build resilience and increase their confidence in their problem solving abilities during challenging situations. Another
approach would be to meet with your children for the first half of each session (excluding the intake appointment) and for
parents to join in the session during the last half of each appointment.
Although I can provide support to both of your children, given Max’s age, he would be permitted to keep information he
shares during sessions confidential, if he chooses. Washington State law enables Children ages 13+ to receive confidential

If you would like to schedule an intake appointment to talk further about your family’s unique needs, please let me know.
For the intake appointment it would be helpful to have the chance to speak with you both without your children present for

approx 30 min and then to invite your children in to the appointment.
Warmly,
Kari Betts, LMFT, CMHS, MHP
+1.425.979.2029  |  LakeSammamishTherapy.com
On Dec 14, 2023 at 12:47 PM -0800, Rob Moyer <rob.moyer@gmail.com>, wrote:

Date Received: Thursday, December 14, 2023 4:50:43 PM GMT-08:00
Good Afternoon Robert and Christine,
Thank you for your message in regards to providing support to your children during this time of transition for your family.
There are several approaches we can take to support your children. One would be that I can meet with your children
individually/separately, and the children can process/share their concerns and feelings about the changes in your family
dynamic. I often think it is helpful to have the entire family together, after meeting with children a few times - so your
children can potentially tell you how they are managing the changes themselves and maybe even ask you both questions. In
addition to your children sharing their experiences, I would introduce them to CBT (cognitive behavioral therapy) to help
them build resilience and increase their confidence in their problem solving abilities during challenging situations. Another
approach would be to meet with your children for the first half of each session (excluding the intake appointment) and for
parents to join in the session during the last half of each appointment.
Although I can provide support to both of your children, given Max’s age, he would be permitted to keep information he
shares during sessions confidential, if he chooses. Washington State law enables Children ages 13+ to receive confidential

If you would like to schedule an intake appointment to talk further about your family’s unique needs, please let me know.
For the intake appointment it would be helpful to have the chance to speak with you both without your children present for
approx 30 min and then to invite your children in to the appointment.
Warmly,
Kari Betts, LMFT, CMHS, MHP
+1.425.979.2029  |  LakeSammamishTherapy.com

=== Subject: Moyer Family Introduction
From: Rob Moyer <rob.moyer@gmail.com>
To: "kari@lakesammamishtherapy.com" <kari@lakesammamishtherapy.com>
Cc: Christine Moyer <christinemoyer@hotmail.com>
Date Sent: Thursday, December 14, 2023 12:47:04 PM GMT-08:00
Good Afternoon Ms. Betts-
My name is Robert and my wife Christine is CC'd on this email. We are reaching out on the recommendation of Debbie
Bayer who we are currently working with. We would be interested in discussing what role you could play with regard to
children's therapy for Max (15) and Adrian (11). Christine and I are currently separated and admittedly not on the best terms
after 29 years together, so we would like to understand how a professional with your background might provide some
therapeutic assistance for our kids in this difficult time. We can naturally discuss our situation and concerns in more detail if
you think you might be able to help us with our shared concern for their well-being.
Please let us know!

best
robert & Christine

well.

if issue.
I put items in suitcases that are yours and gave you another big one and small one to divide.
I'm going to leave items in bedside table as that will be swapped.
So big items are crows nest set, grill, smoker, egg, your bike (are there two?) and bike rack, acrylic table from old office,
skis (are there 3 sets? I thought one was Max's new set but I don't know which one) Dyson fan, speakers from living room,
big bean bag from man cave, Lees old golf clubs, snow blower.

From: Rob Moyer <rob.moyer@gmail.com>

Per our discussion, I think this is what we discussed and additional ideas I had. Open to feedback. As mentioned,
we can use the moving service app for some quick hits and then work on a longer-term plan. We also need to
figure out the former love nest clean/move.
Shared Furniture to minimize cash outlay
TVs : Sitting room & Deck (might ask to swap one for living room TV).
Furniture: I will move our sitting room and guest room stuff to new place
Patio: We agree it's not used, so I will take, but we can truly divide in mediation.
Grills: Happy to share these if you like. The beach grill would be great for ya.
Misc: bean bag? exercise stuff? art? pillows? desk? Is there anything in the man cave?
Kitchen: Realistic division of shared assets, I think you are working on that
Decorations: We can work together in the near term and use long-term mediation.

Linens/Towels: I have a bunch from the beach, but I will want nice stuff. Suggestions?
Other furniture for consideration
Master bedroom: I can use beach stuff as a temp option. We swap the mattresses
Dining Table: I can use the beach one as a temp. The chairs have to go, though.
Beach Couch/Chair: I'll keep my chair and use the couch till we get something better.
Beach Bean Bag: I'll find a place to use that somewhere, do we have an extra at home?
Kids bedroom set: I can use the one at the beach for AD, and use the guest for Max
One kid's desk: We need two. I'll take the beach one and find a new one (1210 or Craigslist)
TV room sectional. You keep ours. I will rent or buy. Hopefully, it's the only cash outlay.
Kids "fun stuff" I may think about
Electronics: PCs, Monitors, gaming (we have some of this)
Play: CL or Amazon "Pop a shot" game?
Play: CL or Amazon Basketball hoop?
Play: CL or Amazon Ping Pong table?
Pets: Fish/Gerbils/Cat/Dog?
I want to be super clear- I still prefer to nest as we said. This will be much more expensive. But, I understand your concerns
and wish things that happened since July had not happened, making it so hard. But I still want to work with you so we are
not forced to do dumb fiscal things again.
